title: DROP box micro hotel lets you roam the world in nomadic luxury
text:
View Slideshow 
Spanish designers In-Tenta just unveiled a tiny, portable hotel suite that can pop up practically anywhere in the world. The DROP Box is a low-impact wooden micro-hotel that can be “dropped” in virtually any location, with little impact on the surrounding environment. The modular eco-structures were inspired by travelers who’d love to see the world’s most remote destinations in sustainable style. 
The wooden modules are manufactured off-site using lightweight materials that facilitate easier transportation with less energy use. From production to installation, the entire DROP process is designed to have minimal impact on the environment , making it a practical option for travelers who’d like to reduce their ecological footprint. 
The tiny structures come in one or two bedroom units, and every DROP Box comes with floor-to-ceiling windows and an outdoor terrace that offers amazing views of the surrounding landscape. Even the bathrooms have large glass walls, allowing guests to commune with nature while au natural.
